Katia Verde Art Gallery is a true gem for exploring Peranakan art and culture. The beautifully crafted batik collection and handmade outfits truly reflect the vibrant heritage and intricate designs of Peranakan clothing. The shop’s diverse range of Nyonya and Chinese style lifestyle items is a real treasure for anyone who appreciates traditional craftsmanship.
Katie’s warm, approachable, and knowledgeable service made my visit unforgettable. Highly recommended!

Lovely store and staff. Great selection of unique goods, perfect for oneself or as gifts. I purchased a beautiful, decorative embroidered fan during my visit. The owner carefully and thoughtfully packed it for me. I am so happy to have found this place.

Katia Verde Art Gallery is a hidden gem for lovers of Peranakan culture and art. The gallery, which previously located at Jalan Besar, offers an exquisite collection of Peranakan treasures that always left me in awe. The sheer beauty and intricate details of their Peranakan collections are truly captivating.

The gallery's dedication to preserving and showcasing Peranakan heritage is commendable. Each piece tells a fascinating story, capturing the rich history and cultural heritage of the Peranakan community. From intricately designed porcelain to vibrant textiles and stunning jewelry, the Peranakan collections at Katia Verde Art Gallery are a true feast for the eyes.
The knowledgeable and passionate the lady owner made my visit even more enjoyable. It provided valuable insights into the Peranakan culture, enriching the understanding of the artwork and its significance. Their enthusiasm and expertise added an extra layer of depth to customers’ experience.

The current gallery's ambiance is also elegant and inviting, creating the perfect backdrop for the Peranakan collections. The attention to detail in the presentation and curation is remarkable, allowing visitors to fully appreciate the beauty and craftsmanship of each piece.

Visiting Katia Verde Art Gallery was like embarking on a delightful Peranakan journey. Whether you are a Peranakan enthusiast or simply appreciate art and culture, this gallery is a must-visit. I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable and enriching experience.
